DOC.brief_summary: Increase in MAP from 65 mm Hg to patients' usual level by fluid improved sublingual microcirculation in early septic shock patients despite EGDT.
DOC.brief_title: Targeting the Microcirculation in Resuscitation of Patients With Septic Shock
DOC.detailed_description: Increase in MAP from 65 mm Hg to patients' usual level by different ways affect sublingual microcirculation in early septic shock patients despite EGDT.
DOC.criteria: 1) patients with septic shock for less than 24 hours. 2) Fluid resuscitation was performed according to the guideline for treating septic shock to maintain the central venous pressure (CVP) for more than 8 mm Hg and central venous oxygen saturation for more than 70%. 3) Patients requiring norepinephrine (NE) to maintain a MAP of 65 mm Hg. pregnancy, age < 18 years, inability to acquire the usual level of MAP, refusal of consent by the patient or relative, participation in other trials during the last three months, hypertensive patients without hypertension treatment.
